intro: Lapeirousia aculeata, commonly known as the Cape buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive black center. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are short and often hidden beneath the soil. Lapeirousia aculeata is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and unique appearance.
